page.title: 15Population Cornards Growth
page.content: After the war Cornard was chosen for development.This involved people moving in from London to Cornard.They came to Cornard because they couldn't afford a house in London and Cornard was a much nicer place.Cornard and Haverhill grew when the Londoners came.Some houses for the newcomers were private built by Janes in 1958 and the GLC built the St. Andrews Road estate in 1966.When the newcomers came work had to be provided. So a larger CAV and factories at Chilton were built.For entertainment there was the community centre and shops on Popular Road.Despite all these factories many were still unemployed. 30% went back to London as they found Cornard too quiet and wanted more livly environment.400 new houses are being built on the Sycamore estate.
